Tuga i bes u Ajaksu zbog suđenja na Stamford Bridžu: Sve je počelo faulom nad Blindom… Gde je VAR?
Holanđani se ne mire lako sa sudijskim odlukama

06 Nov 2019

Pamtiće se sinoćnji remi 4:4 na Stamford Bridžu kao jedan od najzanimljivijih utakmica u istoriji Lige šampiona. Ali Ajaksovim fudbalerima na kraju nije bilo baš zanimljivo…
Besni su i ogorčeni zbog sudijskih odluka koje su vratile Čelsi u igru i omogućile Plavcima da izbore remi, a umalo i pobede na kraju.  
Sve se okrenulo u 68. minutu kada su isključeni Dejli Blind i Džoel Veltman, a Čelsi pogodio za 3:4 iz penala. Blindu je drugi žuti karton pokazan zbog faula nad Abrahamom, ali je sudija prethodno pustio prednost u akciji u čijem nastavku je Veltmana lopta pogodila u ruku. Pa je i Veltmanu pokazan drugi žuti karton i isključen je. U jednom napadu je Ajaks sankcionisan penalom i sa dva crvena kartona.“Nikad ništa slično nisam doživeo. Završilo se 4:4 iako mi ni na kraj pameti nije bilo da će tako da se završi. Držao sam ruku uz telo i ako je sudija već hteo da pokaže na penal, mogao je to i bez drugog žutog kartona”, rekao je Veltman posle meča.
I drugi isključeni “ajaksovac” Dejli Blind je ogorčen suđenjem.“Sedeli smo u svlačionici i gledali ih kako se bore kao lavovi. U jednom trenutku više nismo mogli da gledamo. Veoma sam ponosan na momke. Osećam se kao da smo izbodeni. Gde je VAR kada treba? Sramota. Video sam snimke. I svi su videli da je prvo protivnički igrač mene zakačio. Tu je prvo bio faul. Veltman nije mogao da skolni ruke u drugačiji položaj. Bile su mu uz telo. Šta da radi sa njima? I u prvom meču protiv Čelsija je bilo spornih sudijskih odluka, ali nismo želeli da pričamo o njima. Ne znam šta je u pitanju… Nažalost, Veltman i ja nećemo moći da igramo u sledećem meču protiv Lila, ali imam puno poverenje u momke sa klupe. Ostaje žal što nismo pobedili ovde”, rekao je Blind.
Ajaksov trener Erik Ten Hag je ljut što sudija Đanluka Roki nije koristio pomoć video tehnologije kod spornih odluka.“Kontrolisali smo utakmicu i onda se sve promenilo u jednom trenutku. Faul je prvo bio nad Blindom i tako je sve počelo. Ako imate VAR, onda treba da ga koristitite. Šta je mogao Veltman da napravi u onom trenutku? Kako drugačije da stane? Svi koji su gledali utakmicu na stadionu ili pred televizorom imaju isto mišljenje. Odluka sudije je sve promenila”.

(FOTO: reuters)

Ajax's sadness and anger over the Stamford Bridge trial: It all started with a foul on Blind ... Where's the VAR?
The Dutch do not readily accept judges' decisions

06 Nov 2019

He will remember last night's 4-4 draw at Stamford Bridge as one of the most memorable games in Champions League history. But in the end Ajax's players didn't care much…
They are angry and outraged at the referee's decisions that put Chelsea back in the game and allowed the Blues to pick a draw and almost win in the end.
It all turned in the 68th minute when Daily Blind and Joel Veltman were eliminated and Chelsea hit 3: 4 from the penalty spot. Blind was shown a second yellow card for a foul over Abraham, but the referee had previously let the lead in action, in which continued Veltman's ball hit the hand. Even Veltman was shown a second yellow card and was ruled out. In one attack, Ajax was sanctioned with a penalty and two red cards. "I have never experienced anything like this. It ended 4: 4 even though it never occurred to me that it would end like that. I kept my hand close to the body and if the referee already wanted to point to the penalty, he could have done it without the other yellow card, ”Veltman said after the match.
And the other excluded "Ajaxian" Daly Blind is outraged by the trial. "We sat in the locker room and watched them fight like lions. At one point we could no longer watch. I'm very proud of the guys. I feel like we were stabbed. Where is VAR when needed? Shame on you. I saw the footage. And everyone saw that the first player hooked me. There was a foul first. Veltman couldn't move his hands in a different position. They were with his body. What to do with them? There were controversial referee decisions in the first match against Chelsea, but we didn't want to talk about them. I don't know what it is ... Unfortunately, Veltman and I won't be able to play in the next match against Lilo, but I have full confidence in the guys on the bench. It's unfortunate we didn't win here, ”Blind said.
Ajax coach Eric Ten Hague is angry that referee Gianluca Rocky did not use the help of video technology in the contested decisions. "We controlled the game and then everything changed at one point. Faul was first over Blind, and that's how it all began. If you have VAR, then you should use it. What could Veltman have done at that moment? How else to fit? Everyone who has watched the match in the stadium or in front of the television has the same opinion. The judge's decision changed everything. "
